instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PBUS_G3H: What is PBUS_G3H? This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H When you see PBUS_G3H, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on, cooler rotates.
threads.message:
No signs of oxidation.
Voltage: <SIGNAL>PBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.59V; <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42V;<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 0v; <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> 3.36V ; <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 3.33V; <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>/S5 3.34V; <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 5.13, *Vcore 1.72V, does not fall to 0.82V.

I imagine it is the Me Bios region.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on, cooler rotates.
threads.message:
"Vcore 1.72V, does not fall to 0.82V"
Why do you expect that?
This is not 2936/3115 board...

Do you ger 3V at pin 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>?
Also check <SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CPU_VR_READY</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on, cooler rotates.
threads.message:
0V on pin 3 <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR>
<SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 1.02V; <SIGNAL>CPU_VR_READY</SIGNAL> 0v, when I measure this line the cooler stops rotating.

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 64272, member: 682"]
This is not 2936/3115 board...
[/QUOTE] I thought it was just as logical rsrs.

Test first, to see if is BIOS problem...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on, cooler rotates.
threads.message: No result with several BIOS here on the forum. Mac spins the cooler, but no video, no USB activity. I've already checked the resistors and Ci's <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q8150</TRANSISTOR>, but it still has the same defect.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on, cooler rotates.
threads.message:
Do you get VCORE and <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?

Check with finger if <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> really overheats.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on, cooler rotates.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 0V;  VCORE  1.7V; 
<CHIP>U3900</CHIP> with the finger heats up little.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on, cooler rotates.
threads.message:
<CHIP>U3900</CHIP> should not heat at all.
It doesn't work if <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is low.
Check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PLT_RSET_L</SIGNAL>.
You should test the board removing <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not turn on, cooler rotates.
threads.message: Camera IC can warm up a little bit as soon as it receives power, usually irrelevant.
